subtitle: February 19, 2026 â€“ Your Top Source for Hoops News!

items.headline: Kyrie Irving Sidelined Until 2026-27 Season
items.summary: Dallas Mavericks guard Kyrie Irving will miss the remainder of the current season as he continues to recover from knee surgery performed last March to repair a torn left ACL. The nine-time All-Star is expected to make his return for the 2026-27 season.

items.headline: Joel Embiid Out Tonight with Shin Soreness
items.summary: Philadelphia 76ers star center Joel Embiid will miss tonight's game against the Atlanta Hawks due to soreness in his right shin, experienced over the All-Star break.

items.headline: Trade Deadline Reshapes League Landscape
items.summary: Following the February 5th trade deadline, several blockbuster moves have significantly altered team rosters. Key deals included James Harden moving from the Clippers to the Cavaliers, Anthony Davis and Trae Young heading to the Wizards, and Kristaps Porzingis joining the Warriors in a trade involving Jonathan Kuminga and Buddy Hield.

items.headline: No NBA Games Scheduled
items.summary: No official NBA regular season games were scheduled for Wednesday, February 18, 2026.

items.headline: Deni Avdija Makes Israeli History at All-Star Weekend
items.summary: Portland Trail Blazers forward Deni Avdija became the first Israeli player to participate in the NBA All-Star Game on Sunday, February 15, 2026. He tallied 5 points and 4 assists across 15 minutes of play for Team World.

items.headline: Harden's Immediate Impact in Cleveland
items.summary: Since his acquisition on February 4th, James Harden has propelled the Cleveland Cavaliers to a 3-0 record, averaging 19.3 points, 5.3 rebounds, and 8.7 assists. Center Jarrett Allen has seen a significant boost in his production playing alongside Harden.

items.headline: Injury Updates: Morant, Caldwell-Pope Sidelined
items.summary: Memphis Grizzlies' Ja Morant is dealing with elbow discomfort, while Kentavious Caldwell-Pope is set to undergo finger surgery, impacting their respective teams.

items.headline: Stephen Curry Still Out for Warriors
items.summary: Golden State Warriors star Stephen Curry remains sidelined, with no immediate timetable for his return.

items.headline: Pistons on the Rise in the East
items.summary: The Detroit Pistons have made significant strides over the past two years, climbing to the top of the Eastern Conference, largely attributed to the stellar play of Cade Cunningham.

items.headline: NBA Attendance Remains Strong
items.summary: The NBA continues to show robust fan engagement, with attendance figures remaining steady through the All-Star break. Nine of the 30 teams have successfully sold out every home game this season.
